trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with OfficeSpace Software | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with OfficeSpace Software | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use OfficeSpace Software with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use OfficeSpace Software with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and OfficeSpace Software.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and OfficeSpace Software.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: An OfficeSpace Software single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: An OfficeSpace Software single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to OfficeSpace Software will be able to single sign into the application at your OfficeSpace Software company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to OfficeSpace Software will be able to single sign into the application at your OfficeSpace Software company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for OfficeSpace Software
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for OfficeSpace Software

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for OfficeSpace Software.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for OfficeSpace Software.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type OfficeSpace Software.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type OfficeSpace Software.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select OfficeSpace Software, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select OfficeSpace Software, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>OfficeSpace Software</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>OfficeSpace Software</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to OfficeSpace Software with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to OfficeSpace Software with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on for OfficeSpace Software requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on for OfficeSpace Software requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the OfficeSpace Software application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the OfficeSpace Software application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign=on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign=on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to OfficeSpace Software page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to OfficeSpace Software page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the OfficeSpace Software Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign on to your OfficeSpace Software application (e.g.: "https://company.officespacesoftware.com"), and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the OfficeSpace Software Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign on to your OfficeSpace Software application (e.g.: "https://company.officespacesoftware.com"), and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at OfficeSpace Software page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at OfficeSpace Software page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your OfficeSpace Software company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your OfficeSpace Software company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Admin \> Connectors.
trans-unit.target: Go to Admin \> Connectors.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Admin</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Admin</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click SAML Authorization.
trans-unit.target: Click SAML Authorization.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Connectors</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Connectors</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the SAML Authorization section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the SAML Authorization section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SAML configuration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SAML configuration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at OfficeSpace Software dialogue page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Logout provider url textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at OfficeSpace Software dialogue page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Logout provider url textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at OfficeSpace Software dialogue page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Client idp target url textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at OfficeSpace Software dialogue page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Client idp target url textbox.

trans-unit.source: Copy the Thumbprint value from the exported certificate, and then paste it into the Client idp cert fingerprint textbox.
trans-unit.target: Copy the Thumbprint value from the exported certificate, and then paste it into the Client idp cert fingerprint textbox.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Click Save Settings.
trans-unit.target: Click Save Settings.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into OfficeSpace Software, they must be provisioned into OfficeSpace Software.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into OfficeSpace Software, they must be provisioned into OfficeSpace Software.

trans-unit.source: In the case of OfficeSpace Software, provisioning is an automated task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of OfficeSpace Software, provisioning is an automated task.

trans-unit.source: There is no action item for you.
trans-unit.target: There is no action item for you.

trans-unit.source: Users are automatically created if necessary during the first single sign-on attempt.
trans-unit.target: Users are automatically created if necessary during the first single sign-on attempt.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other OfficeSpace Software user account creation tools or APIs provided by OfficeSpace Software to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other OfficeSpace Software user account creation tools or APIs provided by OfficeSpace Software to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the OfficeSpace Software **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the OfficeSpace Software **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
